plugins.name: q2-phylogeny
plugins.description: Phylogenetic reconstruction, and operations on phylogenetic trees.

plugins.name: q2-vizard
plugins.description: The first choice of wizard lizards for interactive, generalized microbiome data visualization!

plugins.name: q2-annotate
plugins.description: QIIME 2 plugin for functional annotation and taxonomic classification of shotgun metagenomes.

plugins.name: q2-mystery-stew
plugins.description: This plugin exists to define integration tests between interfaces and the framework.

plugins.name: q2-longitudinal
plugins.description: QIIME 2 plugin for paired sample comparisons

plugins.name: q2-fondue
plugins.description: Functions for reproducibly Obtaining and Normalizing Data re-Used from Elsewhere

plugins.name: RESCRIPt
plugins.description: REference Sequence annotation and CuRatIon Pipeline

plugins.name: q2-alignment
plugins.description: Support for multiple sequence alignment in QIIME 2.

plugins.name: q2-quality-control
plugins.description: A QIIME 2 plugin for quality control of sequence and feature data

plugins.name: q2-amrfinderplus
plugins.description: q2-amrfinderplus: QIIME 2 plugin to find acquired antimicrobial resistance genes and point mutations in protein and/or assembled nucleotide sequences with AMRFinderPlus.

plugins.name: q2-feature-table
plugins.description: QIIME 2 plugin supporting operations on feature tables.

plugins.name: q2-sample-classifier
plugins.description: QIIME 2 plugin for machine learning prediction of sample data.

distros.name: amplicon
distros.title: Amplicon
distros.description: A suite of plugins that provide broad analytic functionality to support microbiome marker gene analysis from raw sequencing data through publication quality visualizations and statistics.

distros.name: moshpit
distros.title: MOSHPIT
distros.description: MOSHPIT (MOdular SHotgun metagenome Pipelines with Integrated provenance Tracking) is a toolkit of plugins for whole metagenome assembly, annotation, and analysis.

distros.name: pathogenome
distros.title: Pathogenome
distros.description: A suite of plugins to detect viral genomes and protein sequences from MAGs and contigs for antimicrobial-resistance.

distros.name: tiny
distros.title: Tiny
distros.description: A minimal installation of the QIIME 2 Framework for developers that is intended to be extended with custom functionality and plugins.

children.label: 3. Install the base distribution’s conda environment

children.value:
environment specifically for the
QIIME 2 distribution and release being installed, as there are many required
dependencies that you may not want added to an existing environment.

You can choose whatever name you’d like for the environment.
In this example, we’ll name the environments
to indicate what QIIME 2 release is installed (i.e.
Select the tab that fits the operating system that you want QIIME 2 to run on.
(To install an older version, use the dropdown in the distribution details above.)
These instructions are for users running on Linux or the Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL v2).
These instructions are for users with Apple Silicon chips (M1, M2, etc), and configures the installation of QIIME 2 in Rosetta 2 emulation mode (as ARM builds are not yet available).

CONDA_SUBDIR=osx-64 conda env create \
  --name ((env_name)) \
  --file ((macos_url))
conda activate ((env_name))
conda config --env --set subdir osx-64
These instructions are for users older Intel-based Apple hardware (NOT M1, M2, etc).
Finally, to verify things are working, run:

conda deactivate
conda activate ((env_name))
qiime info
